intro: Tulipa botschantzevae, commonly known as the Karakum tulip, is a rare and striking species native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the genus Tulipa, which includes a variety of bulbous flowering plants in the family Liliaceae. The plant features showy, cup-shaped flowers that range in color from deep red to orange and yellow, often with intricate patterns. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
